In the case of RubyNEAT, I simply iterate the TWEANN a fixed number of time=
s to allow the recurrence to "converge" on a value. It does not make sense =
to me to involve the the innovation numbers for this, but maybe I am missin=
g something?
Ken, what are your thoughts on this?=C2=A0=C2=A0

Kind Regards=
,

Fred Mitchell,=C2=A0


+49 (0)15 259 409475, Skype: flajann
 


     On =
Friday, 31 July 2015, 22:03, "bbjprizes@... [neat]" <neat@yahoogroups=
.com> wrote:
   

 =C2=A0   Hi, I was hoping I could get some help with und=
erstanding how a networks output is calculated when the path between the in=
puts and outputs may have recurring or self referencing links.=C2=A0
I'm no=
t sure what the best way to express the network is but I'll try this.=C2=A0=
// Recurring Examplevar nodes =3D[
=C2=A0{ type: "Input" },=C2=A0{ type: "O=
utput" },=C2=A0{ type: "Hidden" },=C2=A0{ type: "Hidden" }];
var genes =3D =
[{ innovation: 1, inNode:0, outNode:1, weight:0.75, enabled:false },{ innov=
ation: 2, inNode:0, outNode:2, weight:1, enabled:false },{ innovation: 3, i=
nNode:2, outNode:1, weight:0.75, enabled:true },{ innovation: 4, inNode:0, =
outNode:3, weight:0.3, enabled:true },{ innovation: 5, inNode:3, outNode:2,=
 weight:0.4, enabled:true },{ innovation: 6, inNode:2, outNode:3, weight:0.=
5, enabled:true },]
1^|2 --^ =C2=A0|| =C2=A0 |3<^|0
The network originally =
had 1 input and 1 output but through mutation=C2=A0it has gained two hidden=
 nodes and one recurring link.=C2=A0If you evaluating the original network =
with an input value of "1" the output should be 1*0.75=3D0.75.With the addi=
tion of just the two hidden nodes, with weight mutations, I calculate the o=
utput to be =C2=A01 * 0.3 * 0.4 * 0.75 =3D 0.09.After adding in the link mu=
tation between nodes 2 and 3=C2=A0I'm not sure how to sum the inputs into n=
ode 3. =C2=A0Since node 2 relies on the value of node 3 and node 3 relies o=
n the values of nodes 2 and 0.
Most implementations I've seen build an arra=
y of nodes with links in the order of their innovations. Then loop through =
the array and sum the weighted value on the links the node point to. This d=
oes't seem correct to me since node 2's value is calculated based on node 3=
 which hasn't been calculated yet and would be 0. =C2=A0I've considered loo=
ping through each output node and "walking" the links backwards until I rea=
ch and input node and then summing the values on the way back. This is wher=
e I'm running into issues with the recurring links and infinite loops.
My q=
uestion about self referencing links is a little simpler. =C2=A0In the exam=
ple above change the last link between 2 and 3 to be between 2 and 2. When =
you calculate the value at node 2 it would be the weighted value of node 3 =
+ the weighted value of node 2. Since node 2 value is initially 0 it adds n=
o value. =C2=A0When would it ever not be 0? =C2=A0It seems that self refere=
ncing links would always be 0, I must be missing something.
Thanks in advan=
ce for any help or guidance.
Joel

      <div></div><div>Hi, I w=
as hoping I could get some help with understanding how a networks output is=
 calculated when the path between the inputs and outputs may have recurring=
 or self referencing links. </div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>I=
'm not sure what the best way to express the network is but I'll try this.&=
nbsp;</div><div><span style=3D"word-spacing:normal;">// Recurring Example</=
span></div><div><span style=3D"word-spacing:normal;">var nodes =3D[</span><=
br clear=3D"none"></div><div> { type: "Input" },</div><div> { typ=
e: "Output" },</div><div> { type: "Hidden" },</div><div> { type: =
"Hidden" }</div><div>];</div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>var genes =
=3D [</div><div>{ innovation: 1, inNode:0, outNode:1, weight:0.75, enabled:=
false },</div><div>{ innovation: 2, inNode:0, outNode:2, weight:1, enabled:=
false },</div><div>{ innovation: 3, inNode:2, outNode:1, weight:0.75, enabl=
ed:true },</div><div>{ innovation: 4, inNode:0, outNode:3, weight:0.3, enab=
led:true },</div><div>{ innovation: 5, inNode:3, outNode:2, weight:0.4, ena=
bled:true },</div><div>{ innovation: 6, inNode:2, outNode:3, weight:0.5, en=
abled:true },</div><div>]</div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>1</div><d=
iv>^</div><div>|</div><div>2 --</div><div>^  |</div><div>|   |</d=
iv><div>3<</div><div>^</div><div>|</div><div>0</div><div><br clear=3D"no=
ne"></div><div>The network originally had 1 input and 1 output but through =
mutation <span style=3D"word-spacing:normal;">it has gained two hidden=
 nodes and one recurring link. </span></div><div><span style=3D"word-s=
pacing:normal;">If you evaluating the original network with an input value =
of "1" the output should be 1*0.75=3D0.75.</span></div><div>With the additi=
on of just the two hidden nodes, with weight mutations, I calculate the out=
put to be  1 * 0.3 * 0.4 * 0.75 =3D 0.09.</div><div>After adding in th=
e link mutation between nodes 2 and 3 <span style=3D"word-spacing:norm=
al;">I'm not sure how to sum the inputs into node 3.  Since node 2 rel=
ies on the value of node 3 and node 3 relies on the values of nodes 2 and 0=
.</span></div><div><span style=3D"word-spacing:normal;"><br clear=3D"none">=
</span></div><div>Most implementations I've seen build an array of nodes wi=
th links in the order of their innovations. Then loop through the array and=
 sum the weighted value on the links the node point to. This does't seem co=
rrect to me since node 2's value is calculated based on node 3 which hasn't=
 been calculated yet and would be 0.  I've considered looping through =
each output node and "walking" the links backwards until I reach and input =
node and then summing the values on the way back. This is where I'm running=
 into issues with the recurring links and infinite loops.</div><div><br cle=
ar=3D"none"></div><div>My question about self referencing links is a little=
 simpler.  In the example above change the last link between 2 and 3 t=
o be between 2 and 2. When you calculate the value at node 2 it would be th=
e weighted value of node 3 + the weighted value of node 2. Since node 2 val=
ue is initially 0 it adds no value.  When would it ever not be 0? &nbs=
p;It seems that self referencing links would always be 0, I must be missing=
 something.</div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>Thanks in advance for a=
ny help or guidance.</div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>Joel</div><div=
><br clear=3D"none"></div><div><span style=3D"word-spacing:normal;"><br cle=
ar=3D"none"></span></div><div><span style=3D"word-spacing:normal;"><br clea=
r=3D"none"></span></div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div><br clear=3D"non=
e"></div><div> </div>

    </div>
